entry.def: The standard way of expression the idea of AS SOON AS is by preverbal yī 一. [GENERAL]; [[COMMON]]
The standard way of expression the idea of AS SOON AS is by preverbal yī 一. [GENERAL]; [[COMMON]]

sense.def: as soon as (either temporal or logical!)
as soon as, once (then...)
another; the other "一名 by another name"
another source, another person; certain yet others
the other one; another one
all at once; out of the blue; all of a sudden
if by chance, as long as, when by chance
sometimes (... at other times); at some point (...at another point), at some points, (...at other points)

entry.def: Yī 一 and yī 壹 emphasise the uniqueness of what is being concentrated on.

sense.def: concentrate on one thing; be single-minded; be well-focussed one thing
concentrate uniquely on
concentrate!
concentration and focus on one relevant thing
concentrated; focussed
concentrate (one's mind etc)
concurrently

entry.def: The standard word for the unification of what is disunited is yī 一 (ant. fēn 分 "divide").

sense.def: unification (nab!)
(cause to become a unit >) to unite (e.g. the empire); unify (people's outlooks), cause to (continue to be) unified
be united, be unified, be made consistent
be united in spirit, have a common purpose; be all equally inspired with a common will
become united
get united; get unified (by an understood agent)
coordinate
common united purpose; social and political cohesiveness; unified common vision of things; common ideological purpose; esprit de corps

entry.def: emphasises that there is no exception to the general statement, that the phenomenon described is unified

sense.def: all, every, the whole 一國 "everyone in the state"
in all (these) cases alike; all alike; one by one, all; in every case in the same way; in every way, completely
each, every single
any single one of the contextually determinate N
anything
one and the same; essentially the same
form one overall unity; be one and the same; be the same 其N一也 with respect to N they are the same
一律：in one and the same way; pervasively; completely
be the same in respect of N, be the same regarding N
undifferentiated equivalence; sameness; identity
regard as the same, consider to be of the same kind
make the same, cause to be the same
be the same in everyone/everything
be the same as N
one and the same thing
a single time; one time; once (a day)
at one time... at another time
do N once
(preceded by negative) even once
(then) all at once; once and for all
a; a certain; some
some one thing

entry.def: The general word for one is yī 一.

sense.def: one thing; one unit; 此一 "this one thing"
technical term in Laozi: Monad, the The Pristine Oneness (of the Way). 抱一 "embrace the One Pristine Oneness (of the Way)"
one... the other; one thing
just one single; one single entity; only one single; one and only; only one, just one; no more than one; one alone; one single; a single
one
be one (of a defined set)
be (exactly) one, be one in number; be one and the same
one/a certain N1 of the contextually determinate set N2
one person
one of the contextually determinate N; the first of the contextually determinate N
undivided
one out of X
the N2 of one lexically determinate N1
"one"
one single contextually determinate thing N; one N
be one and the same everywhere; remain unadulterated and unchanged; be undiluted and pure
the single; the one and only (great)
unitary entity; unit; unison; Unison; undifferentiated oneness, indifferent equivalence;
one of the N
one of the determinate determinate number of N
one N1
overall unified vision of things; the relevant unifying principle (of the Way as applying to the situation)
method based on identification with the metaphysical primordial Unity
the number one
a single

entry.def: The most general word for the whole of something is yī 一.

sense.def: the whole of (a state etc), a whole 一國"the whole country"
completely, totally
invariantly throughout; once and for all; once and for all time in the same way
endure as the constantly the same

the one (as opposed to the other) 一者 (Perhaps this should be read as "the first" under ONE, but in fact, the reference is not to the first in a sequence but to ANY one in a sequence as opposed to the other)
Read zhè yī > zhèi: this 這一般人 (This is surely the origin of the reading zhèi).
singularly much
completely, totally (with negated V)
the first point
do something for the first time 一再 "if one does something for the first time or for the second time..."
the one and only, only N
as the only object 一成純 “achieves only purity"
only
secondly
make N be monopolised (in someone's hands)
